features.title: Full Compute Governance Coverage
features.summary: 600+ compute governance rules spanning GPU and cost controls.

features.title: Compliance Ledger

x_legacy.long_description:
ComputeGuard extends ComputeScan with enterprise-grade FinOps governance,
deterministic FixPack-Lite remediation, and audit-ready compliance ledgers. It
enforces cost controls for GPU fleets, emits GuardScore upgrades, and ships
GuardBoard overlays so leadership can track remediation health. The blueprint
emphasizes deterministic output, schema-first interfaces, and WASM-safe
execution for Playground demos.

marketing.hero: Eliminate GPU waste with deterministic compute governance.
blurbs: 600+ advanced compute governance and FinOps rules
Deterministic FixPack-Lite remediation and ledger outputs
GuardScore upgrades and GuardBoard overlays for exec-ready reports

ux_goals: Deliver deterministic GPU governance packages for enterprise releases
Surface actionable remediation bundles for GuardBoard and GuardScore consumers

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide deterministic cost governance, remediation hints, and compliance-grade ledgers across GPU and compute-intensive workloads.

security.sandbox_requirement: Playground runtime must be WASM sandboxed

x_legacy.short_description: Enterprise FinOps governance and deterministic remediation for GPU-heavy compute estates.

versioning.breaking_change_policy: Any breaking change requires a guardsuite-core RFC, FinOps ledger migration note, and coordinated release with ComputeScan and GuardBoard.

features.title: Fast Scan Mode
features.summary: Low-latency deterministic scan for CI and pre-deploy checks.

features.title: Full Scan Mode
features.summary: Expanded analysis for deep compute inventories.

features.title: Telemetry Coverage Checks
features.summary: Flags missing metrics/logging for critical nodes.

features.title: Fixpack Preview Hooks
features.summary: Provides deterministic hints for paid Guard fixpacks.

fixpack.notes: ComputeGuard and paid products supply remediation bundles.

interoperability_conflicts: New compute adapters may require GuardScore weighting refresh.
Fixpack preview schema changes impact GuardBoard overlays.
x_legacy.long_description:
ComputeScan discovers compute resources (VMs, instances, GPU attachments),
evaluates sizing, cost, and telemetry posture, and emits canonical findings
for downstream GuardSuite products. It prioritizes deterministic output,
fast CI-friendly runtimes, and fixpack preview hooks for higher-level guards.

marketing.hero: Deterministic compute governance scanner for GuardSuite.
blurbs: Low-latency compute scanning for CI and pre-deploy checks
Canonical JSON findings + GuardBoard-ready metadata
Built-in fixpack preview hooks for paid Guard products

ux_goals: Provide CI-safe compute scans with deterministic issue ordering
Feed paid Guard products with high-signal preview data

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide fast CI-safe compute scanning, canonical findings, and fixpack preview inputs for ComputeGuard, GuardScore, and GuardBoard.

security.sandbox_requirement: Playground runtime must be WASM sandboxed

x_legacy.short_description: Lightweight, deterministic compute resource scanner that feeds GuardSuite scoring, remediation, and dashboard products.

versioning.breaking_change_policy: Any change that alters canonical finding fields or CLI output requires a coordinated release with ComputeGuard and GuardBoard consumers.

features.title: Deterministic Artifact Views
features.summary: Every dashboard references immutable artifact IDs with provenance.

features.title: Signed Export Bundles
features.summary: Produces signed, tamper-evident exports for audits and exec briefings.

features.title: Badge + GuardScore Overlays
features.summary: Visualizes GuardScore, badge eligibility, and remediation progress.

x_legacy.long_description:
GuardBoard ingests canonical GuardSuite artifacts (scan outputs, GuardScore summaries,
badge metadata, compliance ledgers) and renders deterministic dashboards,
investigation workflows, and export bundles. It ensures every view references
immutable artifact IDs, tracks provenance, and keeps signed exports ready for
audits. GuardBoard is how customer teams, SREs, and executives review GuardSuite
posture with confidence.

marketing.hero: Deterministic GuardSuite dashboards for execs and auditors.
blurbs: Signed exports and immutable artifact references
Unified view across scanners, GuardScore, and compliance ledgers
Ready-made overlays for exec briefings and audits

ux_goals: Visualize GuardSuite artifacts with deterministic ordering
Generate signed exports that pass executive and audit reviews

provenance: Derived from GuardSuite Platform dashboard charter
x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide an auditable, deterministic UI and export layer for GuardSuite artifacts with signed bundles, provenance tracking, and badge previews.

security.sandbox_requirement: All exports must be signed and verified before download.

x_legacy.short_description: Deterministic GuardSuite dashboard and export surface that visualizes validated artifacts, GuardScore outcomes, and badge readiness for executives and auditors.

versioning.breaking_change_policy: Dashboard schema changes require migration guides, signed-export verifier updates, and comms to GuardScore + GuardSpecs consumers.

features.title: Deterministic Scoring Contract
features.summary: Fixed precision math, canonical hashing, and no nondeterministic IO.

features.title: Explainable Outputs
features.summary: Provides severity weight breakdowns, pillar contributions, and rule traces.

features.title: Drift + Percentile Engine
features.summary: Synthetic dataset + drift thresholds ensure percentile stability.

future_extensions: Additional pillar weight slots for DataGuard

invariants: Scoring pipeline order must match guardsuite-template evaluator pipeline.
No nondeterministic IO (clock, randomness, locale, filesystem).
All timestamps encoded as UTC ISO-8601 with Z suffix.
Hashing uses canonical_json_utf8 with sorted keys.

x_legacy.long_description:
GuardScore consumes canonical outputs from ComputeGuard, ComputeScan,
VectorGuard, PipelineGuard, and future pillars to produce a single,
deterministic GuardScore per tenant or workload. It enforces
WASM-compatible math, fixed precision, provenance tracking, and
reproducible explainability artifacts so downstream experiences (GuardBoard,
GuardScore API, ScoreBadge publisher) can trust the results. The engine
guards against drift, validates fixpack modifiers, and emits canonical
JSON/CBOR ready for immutable storage.

marketing.hero: One deterministic GuardScore across every pillar.
blurbs: Deterministic scoring and percentile math across OS/arch/runtime.
Explainable outputs with pillar weights, severity penalties, and drift data.
Badge-ready scoring contract trusted by GuardBoard and ScoreBadge.

ux_goals: Expose a single deterministic GuardScore for exec dashboards and APIs.
Provide explainability artifacts (pillars, severity math, drift signals).
Guarantee badge readiness signals for GuardBoard and downstream products.

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide a deterministic, auditable scoring model governing how GuardSuite aggregates issues, weights pillars, applies fixpack modifiers, and signals eligibility for GuardScore-powered products.

security.sandbox_requirement: All GuardScore executions must run inside signed WASM evaluator sandboxes.

x_legacy.short_description: Deterministic GuardSuite scoring engine that converts multi-pillar findings into a single GuardScore, percentile, and badge signal with audit-grade explainability.

invariants: Stages execute strictly in the published order.
No nondeterministic IO or environment branching.
Timestamps encode as UTC ISO-8601 with Z suffix.
Arithmetic must use fixed_64 deterministic math.
Outputs serialize via canonical_json_utf8.

features.title: Authoritative Evaluator Pipeline
features.summary: Ships the canonical stage ordering, invariants, and orchestration.

features.title: Signed Binary Core
features.summary: Provides ABI-locked WASM + native modules with deterministic parity.

features.title: FixPack + Schema Registry
features.summary: Publishes fragment governance, fixpack metadata, and drift enforcement.

future_extensions: Signed percentile snapshots for GuardBoard drift detection
Schema fragment diff API for third-party partners

governance.breaking_change_policy: Any breaking schema, binary ABI, evaluator pipeline, or canonicalization modification requires an RFC, downstream coordination, and regeneration of affected pillars and the template.
principles: Schema-first contracts drive every release decision.
Determinism and WASM safety override performance shortcuts.
All provenance fields must be signed and validated.
evaluator_pipeline_invariants: Stages must run in exactly this order (no additions or reorderings).
No nondeterministic IO such as randomness or local system time.
Timestamps serialize as UTC ISO-8601 with Z suffix.
Canonicalization enforces deterministic key ordering and fixed_64 math.
Outputs emit canonical_json_utf8 with stable hashing.

x_legacy.long_description:
GuardSuite Core provides the canonical runtime layer used by scanners,
guards, scoring engines, dashboards, and governance tooling. It exposes
authoritative JSON schemas, fragment governance, the evaluator pipeline,
canonicalization contracts, provenance validation, ABI-signed binary
modules, FixPack registry capabilities, telemetry schemas, deterministic
snapshot normalization, and WASM-safe execution primitives. Every
GuardSuite pillar consumes this contract as the source of truth for
ingestion, processing, validation, rendering, and drift-free evolution.

marketing.hero: Deterministic foundation for every GuardSuite workload.
blurbs: Authoritative schemas, evaluator pipeline, and canonicalization contracts.
Signed binary core that enforces parity across WASM, Python, and native.
FixPack registry plus telemetry governance for every pillar.

ux_goals: Guarantee deterministic evaluator execution for all pillars.
Expose canonical schemas, fragments, and ABI contracts without drift.
Keep FixPack, telemetry, and observability tooling aligned to governance.

provenance: Derived from GuardSuite Core charter v2026.04
x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide a single, authoritative, versioned foundation for schemas, evaluator pipelines, binary-backed primitives, governance rules, and deterministic behavior across all GuardSuite products.

security.sandbox_requirement: Core CLI must run under WASI for Playground

x_legacy.short_description: Deterministic runtime, canonical schemas, ABI-backed binaries, evaluator pipeline, and governance systems that power every GuardSuite pillar.

features.title: Canonical Product Registry
features.summary: Stores specs, checklists, and GPT instructions with schema validation.

features.title: Deterministic Bootstrap Generator
features.summary: Produces Architect-ready JSON with canonical hashing.

features.title: Audit & Feedback Automation
features.summary: Ingests #FEEDBACK_CONTRACT payloads and tracks migrations.

interoperability_conflicts: Schema format updates require pillar pin bumps.
Bootstrap hash length changes impact Architect clients.
x_legacy.long_description:
GuardSpecs stores every canonical GuardSuite product spec, checklist, and GPT
instruction set. It validates content against the schema registry, produces
deterministic bootstrap artifacts for Architect sessions, and exposes API/CLI
tooling so pillars can automate validation. GuardSpecs is the control plane
for governance rules, migration guides, and deterministic hashing policies.

blurbs: Schema-first registry for specs, checklists, and GPT instructions
Bootstrap generator for Architect and Implementor workflows
Deterministic validation CLI for CI/CD

ux_goals: Keep every GuardSuite spec schema-compliant
Provide deterministic bootstrap artifacts for Architect

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide a single source of truth for GuardSuite specs, checklists, and bootstraps with strict schema validation and deterministic hashing.

security.sandbox_requirement: Bootstrap generation must remain deterministic and offline.

x_legacy.short_description: Canonical product spec + checklist registry with deterministic bootstrap generation for GuardSuite.

versioning.breaking_change_policy: Breaking schema or bootstrap changes require migration guides and downstream coordination with every GuardSuite pillar.

acceptance_criteria: Pillars created via template pass verify + self-test.
Canonically formatted output conforms to output_contract.
Telemetry hooks implemented and within telemetry.limits.
Binary-backed modules used for production builds; fallback rules applied.

adapter_boundary.description: Template defines interfaces; pillars implement provider logic.
adapter_compatibility: Adapters must conform to adapter interface and capability manifest.
Adapters must not perform nondeterministic I/O during canonicalization.

compatibility_rules: Binaries published with ABI v1 are compatible across supported_cpu_arch for 12 months.
ABI changes require major version and migration instructions.

invariants: verify must pass before merge
self_test must pass in CI
snapshot determinism enforced across CI images
help output must be machine-parseable
--json must validate against CLI JSON schema
config must validate against template config schema
config may not override forbidden template fields

determinism.path_normalization: strip absolute paths; separator = '/'; lowercase where appropriate

invariants: Stages execute in listed order; skipping a stage must be explicit and logged.
Stages must be idempotent and deterministic.
No stage may perform nondeterministic IO or unbounded parallelism without guardrails.
All timestamps must be UTC ISO-8601.
UI builds used in CI must produce deterministic SSR payloads for snapshot tests.

metadata.name: GuardSuite Template
metadata.summary: Authoritative template for creating GuardSuite pillars: deterministic, WASM-safe, binary-backed core utilities, standardized lifecycle, and cross-repo integration.

mission: Provide a complete, deterministic, WASM-safe baseline for building GuardSuite pillars.
Guarantee contract compliance, cross-pillar consistency, and governance alignment.
Enable rapid creation of new products with minimal drift.

invariants: No tenant bleed-through.
All artifacts must match scoring/processing tenant_id if enabled.
performance budgets must be validated in CI

policy: Pillars SHOULD NOT directly depend on another pillar's internal artifacts.
Inter-pillar integration allowed only via canonical artifacts published to guardsuite-specs.
Cross-pillar references must be explicit and version-pinned.

principles: Schema-first: pillars extend shared fragments aligned with guardsuite-specs.
Deterministic: identical inputs  identical outputs across OS/arch/runtime.
Security-first: sandboxable, reproducible, binary-backed core logic in production.
Governance-aligned: versioned, lifecycle-controlled, with strict contracts.
Modular extensibility: clear boundaries between template/core/pillar.

invariants: discovery must be idempotent
resource identifiers canonicalized
capability_manifest must be provided by each adapter

provided_by_template: CLI verbs, flags, and output structures
rule registry, rule scaffolder, and rule scaffolding inputs
telemetry hook definitions and telemetry schema
verify & self-test command definitions and expected artifacts
forbidden_overrides: severity mapping algorithms provided by core
CLI core verbs and output contract

inheritance_rules: Pillars extend core fragments; do not redefine canonical fields.

invariants: Events must be JSON and conform to telemetry.schema.
Redact sensitive fields before emission.
Stable key ordering required for ingestion correctness.

template_evolution: spec_version bump requires pillar regeneration guidance

x_legacy.long_description:
The GuardSuite Master Spec consolidates canonical schema links, product
indices, template contracts, CI/validation rules, release cadence policies,
and ecosystem-level integration requirements. It is the single authoritative
reference consumed by the guardsuite-specs generator, CI workflows, and
product repositories to ensure consistent outputs, deterministic remediation
flows, and coordinated releases across pillars.

marketing.hero: Single Source of Truth for GuardSuite product and schema governance.
blurbs: A canonical index for products, templates, and schema versions
Machine-readable rules for doc generation and CI validation
Defines cross-pillar contracts and release policies

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Act as the authoritative index and governance contract for the entire GuardSuite ecosystem, covering product definitions, schema evolution, CI requirements, and cross-pillar integrations.
x_legacy.short_description: Canonical Source of Truth (SoT) for GuardSuite product specs, templates, schemas, integrations, and launch plans.

invariants: Evaluator MUST match template-defined stage ordering exactly.
No random, local time, locale, or env-dependent branching.
All timestamps MUST be normalized UTC ISO-8601 + Z.
All numeric operations MUST use fixed_64 semantics.
All outputs MUST serialize using canonical_json_utf8.
Snapshot normalization MUST produce identical hashes across 3 runs.

features.title: Full Pipeline Governance Coverage
features.summary: 600+ workflow, permission, provenance, and artifact rules.

features.title: Compliance Ledger
features.summary: Audit-grade, hash-chained ledger with provenance links.

features.title: FixPack-Lite Remediation
features.summary: Deterministic, CI-safe remediation snippets.

features.title: Premium GuardScore Inputs
features.summary: Supply-chain and workflow risk signals for scoring.

features.title: Artifact Lifecycle Governance
features.summary: End-to-end artifact signature & provenance validation.

features.title: Pipeline Identity Security
features.summary: Token trust chain, actor impersonation, and identity drift rules.

future_extensions: Signed remediation bundles for partner-led workflows

governance.breaking_change_policy: Any breaking change to remediation semantics, compliance ledger schema, provenance fields, or scoring inputs requires a PipelineGuard RFC, downstream sync with GuardScore & GuardBoard, and coordinated template regeneration across GuardSuite-Template and GuardSuite Core.
principles: Schema-first governance with fixed evaluator ordering.
Deterministic remediation + ledgering beat performance shortcuts.
Provenance and signature validation are always enforced.
evaluator_pipeline_invariants: Evaluator MUST match template-defined stage ordering exactly.
No random, local time, locale, or env-dependent branching.
All timestamps MUST be normalized UTC ISO-8601 + Z.
All numeric operations MUST use fixed_64 semantics.
All outputs MUST serialize using canonical_json_utf8.
Snapshot normalization MUST produce identical hashes across 3 runs.

interoperability_conflicts: Unsigned pipelines or artifact promotion chains
Dynamic evaluator plugins with nondeterministic IO
x_legacy.long_description:
PipelineGuard is the enterprise-grade governance and workflow-security
blueprint for CI/CD. It enforces deterministic CI/CD policy, supply-chain
provenance, hardened artifact lifecycles, signature validation, FixPack-Lite
deterministic remediation, and a full compliance ledger with hash-chain
integrity. The blueprint provides more than 600 workflow, runner, permission,
and supply-chain integrity rules. It integrates with GuardBoard for visual
governance insights, GuardScore for workflow and artifact risk scoring, and
Playground WASM sandbox execution for CI-safe evaluator runs.

marketing.hero: Deterministic CI/CD governance with ledger-grade remediation.
blurbs: 600+ workflow, runner, provenance, and artifact integrity rules.
Hash-chained compliance ledger with premium GuardScore insights.
FixPack-Lite snippets deliver deterministic remediation for pipelines.

ux_goals: Guarantee enterprise-grade CI/CD governance coverage.
Expose explainable ledger + remediation artifacts for auditors.
Integrate GuardScore inputs without nondeterministic drift.

provenance: Aligned with canonical evaluator pipeline from guard-template
x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide deterministic governance, artifact integrity enforcement, rule-driven workflow security, provenance validation, and enterprise remediation across software supply chains and multi-cloud CI/CD pipelines.
rule_categories: Identity Spoofing, Token Trust Chains, and Workflow Tampering

security.sandbox_requirement: Playground runtime must be WASI sandboxed

x_legacy.short_description: Enterprise CI/CD and supply-chain governance with deterministic remediation, compliance ledgering, provenance integrity enforcement, and premium GuardScore intelligence.

acceptance_criteria: All canonical artifacts validate against schemas and DET-001 normalization rules.
Snapshot determinism: 3-run identical hash under supported images.
No remediation artifacts or fixpack content included in repository or outputs.
No core/binary artifacts packaged or referenced.
CLI help machine-parseable (--json) and CLI JSON outputs validate against canonical schema.
Parity tests (python  wasm) pass for representative fixtures.
Adapters are WASM-safe and read-only; any failing adapter tests block merge.

invariants: help must be machine_parseable when --json supplied
CLI must not expose internal IP, remediation content, or binary references
CLI outputs must conform to canonical_output_schema when --json used
Stages must run in the listed order and be idempotent.
No nondeterministic IO, no runtime clock reads, no randomness inside stages.
No stage may attempt remediation or fixpack application.
Adapters must only collect read-only metadata and must be WASM-safe.

fixpack.notes: PipelineScan does NOT execute or ship fixpacks. It may surface *hints* referencing paid fixpacks by **opaque ID only** (no patch content, no patch preview). Any reference must be an ID that resolves only within paid product pipelines.

governance_notes: PipelineScan is a limited, detection-only scanner used to funnel users toward paid remediation products (PipelineGuard).
Ensure all contributor PRs are validated for forbidden content (remediation code, binary references).
Adapter PRs must include wasm safety evidence and a read-only manifest.

visualization_guidance.short_summary: Scanner-level summary suitable for engineering review

metadata.name: PipelineScan
metadata.summary: Lightweight, deterministic pipeline scanner for CI/CD manifests (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Terraform pipelines, container build workflows). Produces canonical, schema-first artifacts consumable by GuardScore and GuardBoard. Intentionally limited to detection + hints (no remediation content shipped). Designed to be WASM-safe and IP-preserving (no paid binaries or fixpack execution).

purpose.brief: Provide accessible, deterministic pipeline security and supply-chain scanning that emits canonical GuardSuite artifacts while protecting paid remediation IP.
goals: deterministic canonical artifacts for downstream consumers
minimal, read-only adapters for CI platforms
strict no-remediation/no-binary policy to protect commercial IP
WASM-safe runtime compatibility for Playground demos and browser runs

forbidden_overrides: core binary modules (disallowed to package or reference)
reimplementation of paid remediation logic or fixpack runtime

rules_must: have severity in [critical, high, medium, low, info]
have title, description, rationale, and remediation_hint_id (opaque)

forbid_ip_exposure_rules: Do not include or distribute guardsuite-core binary artifacts
Do not include remediation snippets or fixpack patches
Do not expose internal ABI manifests

versioning.breaking_change_process: RFC + guardsuite-core coordination + downstream consumer notice

governance.breaking_change_policy:
Any evaluator pipeline modification, schema change, WASM sandbox rule change, UI-export contract change, or deterministic-hash modification requires:
  - RFC approval
  - guardsuite-core parity verification
  - template/evaluator parity verification
  - GuardBoard compatibility validation
  - updated Playground documentation & sample plans

x_legacy.long_description:
GuardSuite Playground is the browser-executed evaluator sandbox for demos,
documentation, AI walkthroughs, and GuardScore previews. All evaluations run
under WASI-constrained WASM with fixed_64 numeric handling, timestamp
normalization, deterministic snapshot rules, and canonical JSON output.
Playground mirrors the authoritative evaluator pipeline, ensuring
cross-runtime parity with Python, WASM, and native-ABI environments.
It provides badge previews, GuardScore inputs, shareable URLs, deterministic
sample plans, and exportable canonical bundles for GuardBoard and Architect.

ux_goals: deterministic outputs
zero-install onboarding
exportable badge-ready JSON
GuardScore preview compatibility

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Provide a zero-install, WASM-safe deterministic evaluator for demos, documentation flows, customer onboarding, and AI-powered product education.

rules: issue suppression must be stable and documented
deterministic fallback required if optimization disabled

security.sandbox_requirement: Playground must run entirely in a WASM sandbox with zero host privileges.

x_legacy.short_description: Browser-based deterministic evaluator and GuardScore preview environment, executed entirely inside a WASM sandbox with canonical GuardSuite pipelines.

versioning.breaking_change_policy:
Any evaluator pipeline, schema, normalized output, or export contract change requires:
  - schema bump
  - GuardBoard compatibility validation
  - downstream consumer testing
  - updated documentation & sample plans

deterministic_normalization_layer.description: Authoritative, cross-pillar normalization and hashing layer used by all GuardSuite evaluators. Ensures perfect parity across Python, WASM, and native-ABI runtimes by enforcing deterministic key ordering, timestamp normalization, numeric fixed_64 contracts, canonical list ordering rules, and canonical_json_utf8 serialization. This layer eliminates nondeterministic drift and provides a stable hashing substrate for provenance, snapshot tests, evaluator parity, and GuardScore integration.
objectives: guarantee evaluator-level determinism across all runtimes
unify hashing behavior across scanners, blueprints, and core engines
ensure zero drift in pipeline snapshot views
preserve human-facing output fidelity while enforcing strict hash-view rules

wasm_notes: path normalization must not depend on OS separators

numeric_normalization.description: Converts floating-point values to fixed_64 integer-scaled form to avoid platform differences (CPython vs WASM vs native). Prevents nondeterministic rounding behavior across architectures.

evaluator_requirements: lifecycle_state and pipeline_trace excluded from hash

features.title: Public Endpoint Detection
features.summary: Detects vector indices exposed to global CIDRs.

features.title: Embedding Storage Encryption Check
features.summary: Flags storage lacking encryption-at-rest.

features.title: IAM Wildcard Detection
features.summary: Detects IAM roles with unsafe vector path wildcards.

features.title: Retrieval Pipeline Configuration Safety
features.summary: Detects missing filters, PII omissions, or risky retrieval params.

interoperability_conflicts: QuickScore mode may require recalibration for GuardScore v2.
Embedding governance model expansion (2026) may introduce new fields.
x_legacy.long_description:
VectorScan provides fast, deterministic governance and security scanning
for vector-serving infrastructure, embedding storage, and RAG
configuration patterns. It emits canonical schemaaligned output,
integrates seamlessly with Playground, and feeds GuardScore and
GuardBoard for scoring and reporting. VectorScan is the top-of-funnel
entry point into the GuardSuite ecosystem.

marketing.hero: Secure your vector stack with instant, deterministic scans.
blurbs: Detect embedding leaks and public vector endpoints
Perfect for Playground paste-to-scan
Upgrade to VectorGuard for remediation & ledger
ux_goals: Scan GenAI apps for policy drift
Pipeline GuardBoard ingest artifacts
Offer instant, deterministic scans for vector teams
Drive upgrades into VectorGuard when remediation is needed

x_legacy.purpose_summary: Detect misconfigurations and exposure risks in vector-serving infrastructure.

security.sandbox_requirement: Playground runtime must be WASM sandboxed

x_legacy.short_description: Free, deterministic Terraform plan scanner for vector databases, embedding pipelines, and RAG-like architectures.

versioning.breaking_change_policy: Any breaking change MUST include a guardsuite-core RFC, updated schema, and coordinated release with VectorGuard.
